Pranay Pandey wrote:
> I am using H-3.0 and I noticed that even after a clean termination of my 
> broad crawl (that consumed the entire 2G allocated for heap), the 2G 
> memory remains occupied.
> If I start a new light-test-job (with no other jobs running), it shows 
> mem-use =1.7G and heap-size =2G right from the very beginning.
>  I have had no other jobs running before I top'ed to see the memory and 
> CPU usage.
> 
> After I killed my heritrix and restarted it, of course things got back 
> to normal.
> Anyone else encountered this memory issue?

Java heaps never shrink once they have grown -- so the 'top' 'VIRT' 
memory number won't go down. However, the web console should show less 
memory used when a job has ended and you've clicked the 'teardown' 
button (which discards all built-crawl structures).

So depending on what tool you're using to get the memory-usage readings, 
there may not be anything wrong with what you're seeing.

- Gordon @ IA
